DataElement.preferredName: Material Process Step Intervention or Procedure Performed Study Activity Method Code ISO21090.CD.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The completed act of processing a material. EXAMPLE(S): freezing, thawing, spinning, embedding, dividing, aliquot, adding additives or growth factors OTHER NAME(S): product manipulation NOTE(S): Material process may be performed on any kind of material, such as specimen, nanomaterial, or biologic. The result of the process may be similar or different kind of material, e.g. specimen may be result of specimen processing step (aliquot or division of a specimen), or alternatively blood product has anticoagulants added to it to preserve product. Other processing steps, e.g. adding growth factor to induce cell growth, may be performed on blood product. A coded value specifying the technique that is used to perform the procedure. EXAMPLE(S): (1) Finger stick, veni puncture, Abdominal/ ascites effusion, Biopsy, Bronchial alveolar lavage (BAL) (for specimen collection); (2) Open, laparoscopic (for cholecystectomy).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Material Process Step Intervention or Procedure Performed Study Activity Method Code
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The tangible substance that goes into the makeup of a physical object.:A sequence of events which produces some outcome.:A specific stage of progression through a sequential process.:An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions._A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: The tangible substance that goes into the makeup of a physical object.
A sequence of events which produces some outcome.
A specific stage of progression through a sequential process.

An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.
Executed and carried through to completion.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.
